TopicTitle: To speak in a fashion similar to an upper-class person of british origin

Articles.Content:
upper clase birt from WALES

oi mate how it hanging!

or in language

oi ffrind sut mae\'n hongian!
Is anyone in Wales upper class?

> 
> oi mate how it hanging!

That\'s upper class Welsh..?

> 
> That\'s upper class Welsh..?

yes it is ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> yes it is ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Why, my lad. I am shocked and appalled. Well, good day!
I say, that\'s just not the Queen\'s English, old chap!
Quite

Edit: nope

What a jolly old necro thread.
Should I make a new one, I like this game
Perhaps that would be best, old bean.
Yes old chap, That would be very gould. Infact I shalt make one for ye queen! good day old chap!

'ELLO WHAT'S THIS? There are eleven pages of forum games? By Jove, let us resuscitate this particular thread, as mine heart pines for such merriment!

That's not the Queen's English, old chap.

This thread must be resurrected with some tea.

So many stereotypes!
I am british and I find this thread offensive. MODS LOCK THIS PLEASE!

Rubbish, this thread is quite something to behold, I think.

Oh lobbocks, I just might have to go to the loo.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-01-15T17:22:49Z" title="01/15/2015 05:22  PM" data-short="9 yr">January 15, 2015</time> by Janos1986**

I do say, chaps, this thread is rather spiffingly good, mmmmyes indeed! Splendid!

I must away, caribou are nibbling at the croquet hoops, cheerio, old teapots, cheerio!

> Oh lobbocks, I just might have to go to the loo.

Oh, poor taste, good sir, poor taste. Very bad form, one must call it a lavatory, if one is indeed to call it anything, what?

You, sir, are indeed correct. Lavatory is the correct term for the chamber that gentleman was talking about. 

In my opinion, we should start to work on the prosperity of our great homeland and, indeed, to please our queen. If you excuse me, I shall now leave to conquer and cultivate other worlds with my dear green friends from Kerbin.

How have such uncouth ruffians not heard of the Water Closet? Ah, but I fear I may have answered myself with that last question.

Also what the blummin' 'eck are you lot doin' thinkin' a British accent always 'as to be one of them airy fairy arty farty posh cockney accents? Ye think we all went t'same school as James flippin' Bond?

Norverners represent. Or summat. Aye.
